snippet: The regulations, which the White House sees as part of a push to curb gun violence, will require insurers to cover care for mental health and addiction just like physical illnesses.
abstract: Obama administration will complete a generation-long effort to require insurers to cover care for mental health and addiction just like physical illnesses when it issues long-awaited regulations defining parity in benefits and treatment; rules are seen as critical to administration's position that curbing gun violence by making treatment more available to those with mental illness could reduce killings and mass murders.

byline.original: By JACKIE CALMES and ROBERT PEAR

lead_paragraph: The regulations, which the White House sees as part of a push to curb gun violence, will require insurers to cover care for mental health and addiction just like physical illnesses.

headline.main: Rules to Require Equal Coverage for Mental Ills
headline.print_headline: Rules to Require Equal Coverage for Mental Ills

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
